1.text: Up-to-date software with the latest features is much better than old but secure and stable software

2.text: I prefer a free but limited software than having to pay for a complete and functional software

3.text: Proprietary software encourages competition, development and evolution of technologies

4.text: Hardware manufacturers should always make their drivers and firmware open source

5.text: An exclusive software is much better than a cross-platform software that requires compromises

6.text: The use of unlicensed proprietary software should be strongly punished

7.text: The release of any software online should be regulated

8.text: I am in favor of Google's monopoly on the western Internet: it offers convenient, useful and free services

9.text: My personal data is fundamental and inviolable

10.text: The regulations on the use of personal data make it difficult to develop online services, favoring the multinationals of the web

11.text: Online service providers should pay taxes in the countries where their services are used

12.text: Internet is a completely free place, where anyone can express their thoughts, without any limitation

13.text: I agree to sacrifice some of my freedom in order to make internet a safer place

14.text: The programmers represent the proletariat of the new millennium

15.text: My country's government should control people with face recognition systems, in order to reduce crime

16.text: We must pay attention to technological evolution: a dystopian future is not science fiction

17.text: Overall, Internet is made up of people who have an identity and must abide by the law

18.text: eCommerce websites heavily damage local economies. Their monopoly must be regulated

19.text: Governments must safeguard the ideologies and traditions of their nations, by censoring websites and social networks

20.text: We must invest in education in order to inform and raise awareness of digital citizenship
